data.name: OpenEvidence
data.description: Launched during the Mayo Clinic Platform Accelerate program, backed by Sequoia and Google, and an official Content Partner of the New England Journal of Medicine and The Journal of the American Medical Association OpenEvidence is the world’s leading medical information platform.
data.enriched_summary: OpenEvidence is a Mayo clinic platform accelerate company that provides an AI-powered medical search platform.
data.metadata_description: The world's leading AI-powered medical search platform.

updates.description: Thank you, Jensen Huang, for the OpenEvidence callout on CNBC. NVIDIA is the fountainhead of our entire industry, and we’re honored to be included among your examples of what’s working in AI.

OpenEvidence is at AAFP FMX Conference!

Come see us at booth #1642 for coffee and to learn more about how OpenEvidence is transforming evidence-based clinical decision-making for family medicine. 

There will be a special announcement at the main stage on Tuesday, October 7th, in the afternoon.

#AAFPFMX #OpenEvidence #Healthcare

OpenEvidence featured on Bloomberg TV. 🎥
Oncologist Dr. Mullangi sits down with Bloomberg to share how she uses OpenEvidence in daily practice. 🔊 Sound on. Watch the segment.

Last week, OpenEvidence hosted our inaugural keynote event, "Medical Search in the AI Era" at Google HQ in NYC — bringing together physician leaders and healthcare innovators to explore how AI is reshaping medicine.

Thank you to Google’s Dr. Peter Clardy, for joining our founder, Daniel Nadler, on stage for a fireside chat on the changes AI is bringing to the industry. And to our physician panel, Eric Collisson, MD, Vishal Patel, MD and Vivek Rudrapatna, MD (and moderator Travis Zack, MD, PhD) who talked about what those changes mean for their practice day to day. 

Special thanks to Sangeen Zeb and the Google Ventures team for your partnership!

OpenEvidence is at DCI Network's "Signal Through The Noise: What Works, What Lasts, and What Matters in Healthcare AI" conference. 

Join us on Friday to learn more about how OpenEvidence is transforming evidence-based clinical decision-making, as well as a special announcement.

#DCINetwork #OpenEvidence #Healthcare

Profile of the “other investor from Omaha,” GV (Google Ventures) Partner and OpenEvidence backer, Sangeen Zeb. Our internal code name for him is “Brother Missouri,” because as steadily, reliably, and dependably as the Missouri River flows unbroken along Omaha’s edge, Sangeen will be there for you like a brother—no matter the hour of day and no matter what you need.

https://lnkd.in/gF3X4hZB

Big news: Open Evidence just became the first AI to score a perfect 100% on the US Medical Licensing Exam. 

OpenEvidence’s AI scored a perfect 100% on the U.S. Medical Licensing Exam, answering every question correctly and explaining the reasoning, citing gold-standard medical sources. Over 40% of U.S. physicians are currently using OpenEvidence for evidence-based clinical decision-making and practice support.

Their next project? Helping students. The team is now developing tools to help medical students learn, test, and apply clinical knowledge at school with the same sources trusted by practicing physicians.

We’re proud to support OpenEvidence as they help shape the future of medical care, and soon education. Congratulations to Daniel Nadler and the team on this incredible milestone!

Today our team launched OpenEvidence Visits, a new feature aimed at assisting clinicians with their patient encounters in real-time. Visits acts as a digital Clinical Assistant that enriches encounter notes with the latest clinical evidence and guidelines, assists with clinical documentation, and allows physicians to manage patient documents and ask OpenEvidence questions using the entire context of their patients' history and documentation.

OpenEvidence Visits is free for all verified US Healthcare Professionals. Read more about it here:  https://lnkd.in/e7Q8pt7t

OpenEvidence will be at AAFP FUTURE this week!

Stop by booth 911 for free coffee and to learn more about OpenEvidence from the team. 

#AAFP #FUTURE2025 #OpenEvidence #Healthcare #Innovation

Join us for an interactive webinar introducing OpenEvidence, your new clinical support tool. 

Designed for all clinicians including attendings, medical students and residents, this session will demonstrate how OpenEvidence can support evidence-based decision-making, streamline your workflow, and enhance confidence on the wards.

Whether you are starting your clerkships or preparing for day one of residency, discover how OpenEvidence helps you think faster, stay current, and make smarter clinical decisions—right when you need it most.

All medical students who attend and register with a valid U.S. institutional email will receive 1 month of unlimited access to OpenEvidence.

Register here: https://lnkd.in/gj3SuMgF

#AAFPFMX #OpenEvidence #Healthcare

Last week, OpenEvidence hosted our inaugural keynote event, "Medical Search in the AI Era" at Google HQ in NYC — bringing together physician leaders and healthcare innovators to explore how AI is reshaping medicine.

Thank you to Google’s Dr. Peter Clardy, for joining our founder, Daniel Nadler, on stage for a fireside chat on the changes AI is bringing to the industry. And to our physician panel, Eric Collisson, MD, Vishal Patel, MD and Vivek Rudrapatna, MD (and moderator Travis Zack, MD, PhD) who talked about what those changes mean for their practice day to day. 

Special thanks to Sangeen Zeb and the Google Ventures team for your partnership!

Big news: Open Evidence just became the first AI to score a perfect 100% on the US Medical Licensing Exam. 

OpenEvidence’s AI scored a perfect 100% on the U.S. Medical Licensing Exam, answering every question correctly and explaining the reasoning, citing gold-standard medical sources. Over 40% of U.S. physicians are currently using OpenEvidence for evidence-based clinical decision-making and practice support.

Their next project? Helping students. The team is now developing tools to help medical students learn, test, and apply clinical knowledge at school with the same sources trusted by practicing physicians.

We’re proud to support OpenEvidence as they help shape the future of medical care, and soon education. Congratulations to Daniel Nadler and the team on this incredible milestone!

Today our team launched OpenEvidence Visits, a new feature aimed at assisting clinicians with their patient encounters in real-time. Visits acts as a digital Clinical Assistant that enriches encounter notes with the latest clinical evidence and guidelines, assists with clinical documentation, and allows physicians to manage patient documents and ask OpenEvidence questions using the entire context of their patients' history and documentation.

OpenEvidence Visits is free for all verified US Healthcare Professionals. Read more about it here:  https://lnkd.in/e7Q8pt7t

Stop by booth 911 for free coffee and to learn more about OpenEvidence from the team.

OpenEvidence is attending the ACP's Internal Medicine Meeting!

Come meet the team, and learn about how OpenEvidence is helping organize the world’s medical knowledge and making it more useful, open, accessible, and understandable to healthcare workers!

#Healthcare #Innovation #IM2025

OpenEvidence is attending SXSW!

Come meet the team, and learn about how OpenEvidence is helping organize the world’s medical knowledge and making it more useful, open, accessible, and understandable to healthcare workers!

#Healthcare #Innovation #SXSW2025

This month, the FDA approved the first xenotransplantation clinical trial. United Therapeutics will transplant kidneys from gene-edited pigs into participants with end-stage renal disease; the first xenotransplant of this trial is expected to occur in mid-2025. 

These aren’t the first kidneys from gene-edited pigs transplanted into living humans, but previous cases were done through compassionate use waivers. 

This trial will explore the safety and efficacy of kidney xenografts, but how is success defined in the burgeoning field of xenotransplantation? Let's see what OpenEvidence says:

👉  https://lnkd.in/gDGwK445 

#Healthcare #Innovation #Xenotransplant #GoBeyondTheHeadline

OpenEvidence AI, the only AI to score above 90% on the U.S. Medical Licensing Examination (USMLE), is proud to announce that it is the AI engine powering Elsevier’s ClinicalKey AI, combining Elsevier’s trusted content (from The Lancet, Cell, and Gray’s Anatomy right down to the most specialized journals and textbooks) with OpenEvidence’s USMLE record-setting, responsible AI. 

For a free early-access preview of the future of AI clinical decision support, contact access@openevidence.com with your name and institutional affiliation.
